text: The Yamato 691 (abbreviated Y-691) is the 4.5 billion year old chondrite meteorite discovered by members of the Japanese Antarctic Research Expedition on the blue ice field of the Queen Fabiola Mountains (Yamato Mountains) in Antarctica, on December 21, 1969. ==History== Yamato 691 was one among 9 meteorite specimens identified by the Japanese Expedition Team in 1969. It was later studied at the Max Planck Institute for Chemistry, Mainz, Germany. On April 2011, NASA and co-researchers from the United States, South Korea and Japan have found a new mineral named "Wassonite" in Yamato 691. ==Composition and classification== This meteorite is a stony enstatite chondrite. Minerals reported from the meteorite include: * Troilite * Spinel * Augite * Diopside * Enstatite * Pigeonite * Albite * Nepheline * Iron * Olivine * Wassonite - discovered in April, 2011 ==See also== * Glossary of meteoritics ==References== ==External links== * Mindat.org * Petrochemical study of the Yamato-691 enstatite chondrite (EH3) II: Descriptions and mineral compositions of unusual silicate-inclusions (1988) * Trace element composition and distribution of Yamato-691, an unequilibrated enstatite chondrites (1988) Category:Meteorites found in Antarctica
title: Yamato 691
